TextBlock.Text: OKALIS: Oh my goodness! I was hiding behind one of the trees on the upper ring, and observed one of the campsite occupants return!
NESIA: Did they see you as well? If they did, then how did they react?

OKALIS: They did not notice me at first. However, when I moved out from behind the tree to try and make contact, they turned toward me before fleeing. Notably, they appeared to swim through the air using the webbing on their hands and feet!
NESIA: Very interesting, especially given your note that they did not appear to have eyes. Did they seem to have any obvious reason for returning?

OKALIS: Actually, they appeared to be looking for something. I believe that they found it just before I showed myself, but dropped it as they left. It appears to be some sort of painted tablet. Perhaps I should attempt to return it to them?

AZOLLA: While we had previously decided that it was best to not initiate contact, the fact that they did not attack you seems to indicate they are not hostile. Because of this, it may be best for you to return the item.
OKALIS: Absolutely! With any luck, Iâ€™ll be able to get close enough to them to get a better idea of their appearance!
AZOLLA: Okalis, you were explicitly instructed not to attempt to interact with them! What if they had attacked you!
OKALIS: I know, I know, but I was simply too curious to not try and see the other species. We are Nomai after all.
SENNETTI: Really? What did they look like? Did they seem friendly?

OKALIS: Worry not, friend, they did not seem to be hostile. I was fairly far away, so I did not have an ideal view on them. However, I was able to tell they have large, ear-like frills on both sides of their head, a large tail, as well as webbed hands and feet. To top it all off, they seem to have no eyes!
SENNETTI: How strange! How do you suppose they navigate without vision?
OKALIS: I am uncertain, but they did seem to notice me when I stepped out from behind the tree. Perhaps they possess some form of echolocation?
